publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1705.1 Mr Brian Monteith: The United States of America—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1705) in the name of Karen Whitefield, leave out from "believes" to end and insert "is concerned that Senator John Kerry’s protectionist policies may limit opportunities to Scottish businesses to export to the United States and be generally detrimental to Scottish businesses and jobs but understands that it is for the people of the United States to choose their next President without interference, and believes that MSPs should concentrate on matters pertaining to Scotland when, under Labour, Scotland has seen the destruction of the Scottish fishing industry, NHS waiting times rise, crime rise, average council tax rise, assaults on teachers rise, water bills rise and the cost of the new Parliament building rise."

S2M-1705.1 Mr Brian Monteith: The United States of America—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1705) in the name of Karen Whitefield, leave out from "believes" to end and insert "is concerned that Senator John Kerry’s protectionist policies may limit opportunities to Scottish businesses to export to the United States and be generally detrimental to Scottish businesses and jobs but understands that it is for the people of the United States to choose their next President without interference, and believes that MSPs should concentrate on matters pertaining to Scotland when, under Labour, Scotland has seen the destruction of the Scottish fishing industry, NHS waiting times rise, crime rise, average council tax rise, assaults on teachers rise, water bills rise and the cost of the new Parliament building rise." Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Alex Johnstone*, Murdo Fraser*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*
S2M-1705.1 The United States of America (lodged on 22 September 2004) Alex Fergusson*
